forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. West southwest wind around 16 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 61. West wind 16 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle layer of clouds hovers, softly embracing the city. The temperature dips to a mild 53 degrees, accompanied by a brisk west-southwest wind that dances through the streets at about 16 mph, pushing the day closer to its sunlit potential. As the morning stretches into afternoon, expect the sun to push through the clouds, offering a tentative warmth with a high of 61 degrees. The breeze will pick up, escorting occasional gusts that may flirt with 28 mph, playfully rustling the leaves and clothing of those venturing outdoors.

The day unfolds with a tranquil clarity, although the marine layer lingers in the distance, hinting at a lingering presence of fog that remains more spectral than imposing. Those in search of outdoor activities should seize this moment to explore quieter pathways or perhaps enjoy a reflective stroll by the bay, where the cool air mingles with the warmth of the sun, creating an inviting atmosphere for contemplation. Dressing in layers would be wise—an adaptable ensemble to navigate the cool morning and give way to the brisk energy of the afternoon. With the weather set to become more pleasant, securing a cozy café spot or visiting a local bookstore might just be the remedy for an easygoing midweek charm.
